arm_group.description: Coronary angiography procedures performed using transfemoral access
Coronary angiography procedures performed using left radial access site.
Coronary angiography procedures performed using Right radial access site.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study compares radiation exposure parameters between coronary angiography procedures
      performed by left wrist, right wrist or groin (femoral) procedure access site

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Evaluation of Vascular Entry Site and Radiation Exposure: REVERE Trial

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients referred for coronary angiography will be randomized to either left radial, right
      radial or femoral arterial access sites, and the coronary angiogram will be performed in a
      standard fashion, including left ventriculography. Radiation exposure parameters including
      Air Kerma, Dose-area product, Fluoroscopy time and Operator radiation exposure will be
      recorded. Operator experience as well as demographic data will be recorded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients undergoing diagnostic coronary angiography

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  non-availability of one or more of the three access sites History of coronary artery
             bypass graft surgery Need for percutaneous coronary intervention.

study_pop.textblock: Patients referred for diagnostic coronary angiography

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Evaluation of Vascular Entry Site and Radiation Exposure: REVERE Trial.

other_outcome.description: operator radiation exposure will be measured by a personal dosimeter worn by the operator outside the lead apron on the vest pocket.

oversight_info.authority: India: Indian Council of Medical Research

primary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure Air Kerma (cumulative) at the end of the procedure of coronary angiography.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
